intro: Cynoglossum dubium, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Cynoglossum dubium is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
